- Find people and expertise Global International students Visiting delegations University of Southampton Delhi International Office Visiting fellowships University of Southampton Malaysia - Partnerships and initiatives Online master's degrees View all staff Gary Wills PhD, CEng, FHEA, MIET Research interests Internet of Things (IoT), Data Protection, Information Assurance, More research Connect with Gary Email: gbw@ecs.soton.ac.uk Tel: +44 23 8059 2831 Google Scholar ORCID On this page About Research Publications External roles and responsibilities Biography About Research Publications External roles and responsibilities Biography About Gary Wills is an Emeritus Fellow in Computer Science at the University of Southampton. He graduated from the University of Southampton with an Honours degree in Electromechanical Engineering, and then a PhD in Industrial Hypermedia Systems. He is a Chartered Engineer (CEng), a member of the Institute of Engineering Technology (MIET), a member of The International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP), and a Principal Fellow of the Higher Educational Academy (PFHEA). He is also a visiting professor at the University of Cape Town and a research professor at RLabs. Gary's research project focus on Secure Systems Engineering and applications. Gary is qualified to undertake audits for Information Assurance (IASME and ISO27001), Cyber Essentials, GDPR readiness and Consumer IoT Security. Gary is also a certified Data Protection Officer. Research Research groups Member of: Centre for Health Technologies Southampton Marine and Maritime Institute Centre for Resilient Socio-Technical Systems Supply Chain Excellence Centre Research interests Internet of Things (IoT), Data Protection, Information Assurance, Cyber Security, Current research Gary's research focuses on Secure Systems Engineering and its applications. Gary works cross-discipline with colleagues from industry, and academia. His research can be grouped under a number of themes: Internet of Things, Cyber Security, Information Assurance and Data Protection.
